artist: Artist: Claes Janz. Visscher II; Artist: after Maarten de Vos
creditline: Gift of James A. Bergquist, Boston, in honor of Rachel McGarry
description: woman wearing a crown seated at center flanked by pair of lions, with Jesus with a cross reaching into a window behind her, touching her PL shoulder; group of figures at center and left, with a standing man pointing with a staff at a pair of tablets; smokey fire on raised altar with standing and kneeling figures at top center; text at bottom
inscription:
In plate, lower left: Catica.5.1.
In plate, lower right: M. de Vos inventor  /   ICVisscher  Excudit.
text: This Christian allegory is a two part scene with the interior of a Jewish temple at the left and the exterior at the right. Inside a priest stands in the bimah using a pointer to lead the assembled congregation through the texts, presumably the Tem Commandments, inscribed on tablets. In the forground, an elaborately dressed woman sits on a throne. She probably represents Faith. Outside stands Jesus. He holds a large cross and has nail wounds from his crucifixion. He puts his right hand through a small window, drawing the attention of the seated woman, thus suggesting another way besides Jewish tradition.
title: Plate 5, from "The Song of Solomon"
